author: GamingBolt
description:
Layoffs aside, Microsoft has had a pretty solid year with video game releases. Despite blockbusters like Fable and Gears of War: E-Day launching next year, it's already delivered some big games. 

However, there have also been some notable misses and outright missing titles, particularly Bethesda Game Studios' Starfield. Touted as one of the biggest games of all time back in 2023, it would quickly slip into obscurity, even among some fans of the developer. Last year saw several updates and the horrendous Shattered Space expansion, but this year has been...quiet, aside from that minor update.

What's going on? Where's the second expansion, or at least the announcement for it? When is Bethesda going to announce all the "exciting things planned" for 2025? That is the question.
title: Seriously… Has Bethesda Deserted Starfield or What?

author: GamingBolt
description:
Set to be the biggest post-launch Nintendo Switch 2 title yet, Donkey Kong Bananza comes with a bunch of exciting mechanics, collectables, secrets, and activities making it a surefire must own for the just-released console. 

Seriously, just 5-minutes watching Nintendo’s recent gameplay deep dive video should be enough to convince you DK Bananza is a must play, but if somehow you’re on the fence this feature will detail 15 things you need to know before you buy - including story overview, character customisation, side activities, the array of collectables, and those all important mechanics which - as you’ve surely noticed already - are build around satisfying destruction. 

In fact, as you’ll see, nearly everything in DK Bananza can be smashed, bashed, and crashed in exceedingly exciting ways.
title: Donkey Kong Bananza - 15 Things You ABSOLUTELY Need To Know Before You Buy

author: GamingBolt
description:
Not only was Grand Theft Auto 4 proof at the time that the franchise could continue to outdo itself and set new standards for open world gameplay, but it was a statement that a video game could be the best place to tell a serious and compelling narrative, which it remains to this day. 

For that reason, whether or not you’ve been to Liberty City before, Grand Theft Auto IV remains an essential piece of gaming history that is absolutely still worth experiencing.
title: Grand Theft Auto 4 Review - Still A Masterpiece Almost Two Decades On
